text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 28 in today's
episode I have an idiom for you bear the
brunt this looks to be a interesting
idiom do you know what it means come
let's find out what it means and how to
use it in your daily conversation bear
the brunt so if you bear the brunt of
something it means you suffer the worst
or you can say you bear the impact or
the effects of something
it basically means receiving the worst
part of something unpleasant or harmful
for example an attack or an accident so
when you bear the brunt you get the
greater amount or larger part of
something really bad or flivver
criticism or unpleasant event all right
now let's look at some example sentences
to understand the use of bear the brunt
in your daily conversation example 1
Robert bore the brunt of the crash
because he was right at the front of the
car example 2 mary had to bear the brunt
for losing an important client as she
didn't email the job order on time
example 3 people living in the low-lying
areas of Mumbai always have to bear the
brunt of heavy rains
example for ordinary citizens will bear
the brunt of higher taxes example 5 the
team's coach bore the brunt of criticism
because the players he selected
performed badly example 6 towns that
bear the brunt of floods are usually
those that are located close to a river
